definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
surname Ju
to bring up/to rear/Taiwan pr. [ju2]
body/oneself/personally/to bow
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
care-worn/distressed/tired/overworked/sick/weary
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

sentences.english: It is a charge to keep and I will give it my all.
sentences.chinese: 它是一項要履行的職責，我將爲此鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來總理畢生爲中國革命鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: He ended up working with the terminally and critically ill children.
sentences.chinese: 他在對那些垂死的，重病的孩子們的工作上鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: His life in the struggle for the ideals for Chu dedicated.
sentences.chinese: 他一生都在爲理想奮鬥，爲楚國鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: He really gave his all till his heart ceased to beat.
sentences.chinese: 他真是鞠躬盡瘁，死而後已。

definition: respect for the wise
chastity/virginity (of women)/moral integrity (of men)/loyalty/constancy
to use up/to exhaust
to praise
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
glorious achievement (idiom)
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
a genius/a talented person
diligent and attentive/assiduous/sincere
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to surrender and pay allegiance to
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
fig. the man sings and the woman follows/fig. marital harmony
